content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
No new structures have been successfully established on the map during these steps. The agent made several attempts to deploy a Lab supply structure at Position (0.5, 2.5) – a facility intended to receive and distribute Automation Science Packs for research – but none were placed due to inventory shortages and resource deficits. (Other processing units such as furnaces used for smelting were referenced for production purposes but were preexisting rather than constructed by the agent in this cycle.)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Parameter Errors with get_entities
  – Incorrect invocation led to errors such as “got an unexpected keyword argument ‘radius’” and “takes 0 positional arguments but 3 were given.”
  – Tip: Always verify the API signature before calling get_entities, ensuring that only supported keywords and the correct number of positional arguments are used.

• Lab Placement and Inventory Verification
  – Attempts to place a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) failed with messages indicating “No lab in inventory.”
  – Tip: Confirm the availability of required structure components in the inventory before attempting placement.

• Lab Crafting Resource Shortages
  – Multiple crafting errors occurred when trying to produce a Lab, with failures citing missing sub-ingredients such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables.
  – Tip: Ensure that all intermediary ingredients and prerequisites for Lab production are sufficiently stocked prior to initiating the crafting process.

• Handling None Returns in Entity Collection
  – An error (“NoneType object is not iterable”) was encountered when iterating over lab entities returned by get_entities.
  – Tip: Validate that the returned collection is a valid iterable (using an empty list as a fallback if necessary) before performing iterations.
